page.title: 10Sunday Shopping Revolution.
page.content: Perth's{Tesco Store}on the Edinburgh Road was opened in{1977.}It's named after its founder Mr.Cohen and his wife Tess.They{employ 60 full time}and {120 part time workers.}Tesco has 13000 {customers}a week and on average 1600 daily. Because{Scot's law}differs from Eng- lish law we have had{Sunday shopping for a while.{Parliament}is still arg- uing about it for{England.}Tesco was the first hypermarket in Perth to move with the times.The part time staff do not mind because they get double pay. This{new amenity}is{popular}with local shoppers and travellers. Tesco run{free bus services}from out- lying districts to promote trade. They find that their{Garden Centre}attracts customers. A newly{modernised filling station completes this thriving corner of Perth.
